alert.note: Alert for Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 02 at 7:15PM PST until January 03 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...LOCALIZED BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW CONTINUES WHILE ANOTHER ROUND OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW ARRIVES OVERNIGHT INTO MONDAY... .Gusty southeast winds continues to cause blowing and drifting snow across the Palouse, Pomeroy area, and the Camas Prairie tonight into Monday. The threat for blowing and drifting snow will expand north and west toward Ritzville, Davenport, and Airway Heights overnight. Snow that is on the ground now will drift across roads and possibly cause significant visibility reductions. The next round of moderate to locally heavy snow will spread from the Cascades into northeast Washington and north Idaho by Monday morning. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Number 1 Canyon, Waterville, Badger Mountain Road, Cashmere, Mansfield, Pangborn Airport, Chelan, Number 2 Canyon, Entiat, and Wenatchee. * WHEN...Until 1 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
